intro: Bonnetia holostyla, commonly known as the white bonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and typically have a hairy texture. Bonnetia holostyla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
